text: Again, business and first class look great, too bad that is unobtainable unless you have tons of credit card points or are super wealthy.
I apologise for the frustrating moment kindly check on your private message I have already sent a message kindly respond back please for further assistance.
supply and demand! Grind out that reserve card and hope for an upgrade!
I've occasionally been able to get good deals. I had to book far in advance.
you don't have to be super wealthy to book business or delta one. I usually book my tickets well in advance. Infact I booked my flight to Barcelona last year. Got a great deal.
what was your great deal? I'm sure that your deal is completely out of reach for most travelers.

maybe 1 way it might be doable but over like 600k round trip for delta one or well over $2,000 if you use cash is definitely needing to be somewhat rich. I’ve had my card for 5 years. Have 180k miles and got the 80k bonus as well.. so it’s taken quite some time
there is no first on this aircraft.
wealth has zero to do with it. Not all flights are built the same and there’s ton of deals and discounts to go around.
totally agree with you

you can always go fly Southwest or Frontier. 
 What’s your problem?
There is no shame in Southwest!

Katya Elizabeth yes Spirit. There you go. Now dry the 
 eyes and go fly equal and empowered.

Katya Elizabeth wrong. I am a median income earner, and I have a SkyMiles card with plenty of miles saved up to fly business class usually once a year. I don’t travel for business either. It’s very easy to rack up miles pretty quickly. And if you search correctly and smart, you will find really good deals on flights.
Julie Schultz well said!! I am too and the platinum ammex delta card is fantastic to earn points faster and free flights.
I always felt the same way until the last month. A few months ago, I bought a first class ticket to MSP and I just checked the prices and they have gone up over $1,000 per ticket.
Yikes!
luxury items… kinda called first class.
traveling for pleasure at all is a luxury.
so then having to pay extra for extra luxury isn’t a real issue is it?

no, if you have the money for it, go for it. Just realize most people do not have the money for it like most do not have money for a Lamborghini, Birkin, or other “luxury items”. But if you have the money for it, who cares.

I am not considered wealthy (halfway between lower and upper middle class in my state) but I exclusively fly business class. It really isn't much more expensive than the main cabin and it's super easy to get skymiles points from my credit card to pay for it or even get it discounted. I frequently get free upgrades to business or first as well. Not to mention my companion flyers get the same exact upgrade if I do.
I don't care, as long as the crew is friendly and I arrive safely on my destination I'm satisfied. Keep on going back to DL when we can.
Which will be unlikely with our economy going down the tubes. The only people who will be able to afford to fly will have their own private airplanes.

You don’t have to be wealthy nor do you have to use your credit card points. Just become a SkyMiles member, earn the qualifying MQD’s and you’ll gain status..Once you move up the tier you will really see the perks
You don't need to be "super wealthy" to fly in either class. Its called saving your money up.
The circle of life!
Hello, it's unfortunate for the challenge you encountered. I would like to closely look at the concern raised. Please check your DM

Delta Air lines is the company for you if you want bad service. They make excuses for their bad service. They have bad customer service after you become a customer. Supervisor will hang up on you when you complain about their service. They give more respect to their bad employees than the customers who are paying them. Customer service believes that Delta Air lines has so many customers that it doesn’t matter if they run a few off.
sad.

Sam Dixon you are to entitled your opinion. Ask yourself what kind of passenger you are and a person. Comments such yours denote loneliness and a huge inferiority complex. Lets be thankful we live in a country and culture. Where we have choices …. Spirit Airlines. Is more likely to be your choice….. Enjoy

my family and I will only fly delta. I don't know what happened to make you dislike delta so badly but whatever it was you need to give them another chance. They are by far one of the best airlines in the world.

Sam Dixon Don’t know what happened to you, but I have flown on several airlines and Delta is by far the best. I have never had any problems unlike other airlines. I find their customer service by far better than most companies in general. I had an emergency situation and the flight attendant was amazing. I’m sorry you had such a bad experience, but I will only fly Delta.
I wonder what else in the hospitality service you don’t like I have a feeling you’re a serial complainer.
Kindly provide us with your booking reference and further details about your experience via private messages for us to look into this.
Timbuktu could be interesting
Delta is consistently rated #1 for customer service. I don’t fly anything else when given a choice. Sounds like you need to try other airlines so you will find one you like.
Oh come on nothing can be worse than United?!
thanks for letting us know you have no idea what you're talking about. Go fly Spirit or American and go away.
Spirit might be an airline to try out.
amen.
been flying Delta for years and they've been awesome. Did you book them through 3rd party?
You sound like a Russian bot.
Just give us more leg room in coach, that’s all we want
I want more shoulder room too. And more horizontal.

it often pays to book back there and take your chances, but watch for upgrades to the Premium Economy section. I think business is a waste, but Premium is extremely comfy. I upgraded from Frankfurt to Boston on Lufthansa for $170 last May.
The seats look even more uncomfortable
why not find out moan moan moan
No they don’t
When are you getting your 1st 787 Dreamliner?
They don’t have any on order……
that’s why I asked?

Nick Koons Might that have something to do with Boeing’s long list of problems? This isn’t an optimal situation for Delta or many other airlines. Boeing is in essence pushing their customers in to the awaiting arms of Airbus. Doesn’t mean that’s what’s best for Boeing’s customers
I don’t think that’s true – Delta loves their airbus aircraft. It may be new to them, but they work really well for them.
You could very well be correct. I guess what I’m really seeing is Delta transition to Airbus out of choice. Thanks for your feedback
They have 100 Max-10s on order. And they could have kept NW’s 787s on order, but chose to cancel quite a while ago. So they definitely are making choices they don’t have to.
Very interesting! I stand completely corrected!
Delta does not have any 787 orders currently on the books. Their only Boeing order currently is for 100 737-Max10’s. Their current widebody order includes A339’s, A359’s, and A350-1000’s.
yes I know about 737-Max 10 order.
they must have got those 737s for next to nothing, otherwise, they’d be cancelled already for the A321neo. Which may happen if Boeing can’t get their crap together soon.

I’m sure they got a pretty good deal on them. Especially for the max 10 seen as how Boeing can’t seem to get it certified. The delivery issues with the max and 787 have both hurt airlines like American but Delta was smart in their approach with airbus’ stability.

you have Richard Anderson to thank for that. He had experience with Airbus from his NWA days, and seeing as how he ran the airline that absorbed his former airplanes, he saw it as a great fit for the fleet. Boeing probably gave them the “buy American” guilt trip. I’m for “buy American,” but not if the products are garbage.

you have Richard Anderson to thank for that. He had experience with Airbus from his NWA days, and seeing as how he ran the airline that absorbed his former airplanes, he saw it as a great fit for the fleet. Boeing probably gave them the “buy American” guilt trip. I’m for “buy American,” but not if the products are garbage.
well I’ve noticed that Airbuses have wider coach seats than any of the Boeings

The Import-Export Bank, the great American SHAM ….creating unfair competition and advantage on a global scale (benefiting many oil rich middle eastern airlines including Emirates and Etihad), all the while, undermining other american airline companies that then must compete with these foreign airlines all WITH US TAXPAYER MONEY!
they inherited a very nice and robust 787 order from NW which they subsequently cancelled. Things would be so much different (and better IMO) if they had kept that order.
yes I think you’re so right.I believe they’re trying to become an all Airbus Fleet.
the 787 is a remarkable aircraft and it would fit in the fleet so well. I just love flying them. I’m happy most SkyTeam carriers have some so there are some good chances to fly them.
the a350 is quite comparable with the same cabin air pressurization system to my knowledge.
I will take a a350 over 787 any day. Seats are wider.
They're doing just fine with the A330's and A350's though. That Neo looks sharp.
Yes they are but they could be doing so much more. And we could he getting rid of the tired 767-300ERs sooner
right!!
not happening. Happy that the 350-1000’s are coming.

’Dreamliner’. Try flying economy with the ‘slimline’ seats most 787 operators go for. More stretched fabric rather than proper padding. Still, free back massage when anyone puts anything in the seat back pocket behind you. Only plus point is the reduce cabin pressure differential and higher humidity, but other than that the race to the bottom in economy continues with the 787….
an airplane is outfitted the way the airline orders it. If delta orders extra padding in the seats, that’s how they are done.
Yes. I know.
which costs the airline more...so it's not going to happen
More than likely never and I’m glad.
, I won't fly on a 787. There have been to many issues with them.
lol
Those seats look hard as rocks.
cant be worse than the A320Neo FC seats
you get what you pay for
I totally agree!!!
Try them out for yourself upgrade to ecom plus or business see the difference
they are

all show and no substance
all depends on the crew and at least it’s not spirit
My family flies Delta for most of our flights. Always have an excellent experience.
they are literally the least common denominator. Every other country has a higher grade premium airline. We have the literal least among the best. Womp womp
Now add starlink so the Internet matches the interior!
no paying Elon Musk for anything until he stop cutting funds from everyone else! We don't want oligarchs!
Temes Tess so you support funding SpaceX and Tesla but cutting American jobs and American programs that protect our nation?

Temes Tess Clinton and Obama were certainly not freezing programs and cutting jobs from all depts without any understanding of what is at stake. Get your head out the sand and quit pretending this is normal. You are ok with billionaires taking from the poor and lining their own pockets.
no kidding best comment yet!
delta has ViaSat free high speed WiFi.
The internet hasn't really been a problem on any flights I've been on that have it enabled.
Hawaii flights have ZERO internet.
That sucks.

Asia / Australia in desperate need of superior wifi product. What worked in the past was taken away.. now, a terrible and always unreliable product is offered. How the business travel continues to accept this is curious. Affects passengers AND crew…

I wish you would have mattress pads for DeltaOne on ALL routes like the other high end international airlines (like you try to position yourself to be) do for their business class. Nothing like paying $10k+ for a DeltaOne seat that is rock hard lol
Too bad Delta is not what it once was. Still some good flights attendants on certain routes.
That’s unfortunate if you didn’t get served. My boyfriend and I fly with Delta often and we always get served.

I've been flying Delta nearly every year since it took over Northwest. I'm 78 and since I started flying during university days I've probably accumulated 500,000 miles. I'm rather thrifty with my money but enjoy using mileage to upgrade a little. Even upgrading from the cheapest seats just a little is nice. I've only flown first class one time when I got out of the army and was asked if I would like to move up to first class. Nice option when finishing army days.
Kindly provide us with your booking reference and further details about your experience via private messages for us to look into this.
But because I fly between domestic airports in the states, I'll be stuck on 30 year old CRJ's and 717's that have been renovated to look like the interiors were from the late 2000's.

the late 2000's??
the nostalgia is real, but so is the legroom struggle.
flew jfk-sfo-jfk last week. Both 767-300er's I was on were 34 years old. Seat was hard like sitting a wooden bench. IFE kept rebooting.

i always have chosen delta in the past, regardless. however, after my last experience ( 3 weeks ago), with some of the rudest delta employees ive ever encountered, next time i book a flight, ill remember how those couple delta reps treated me.
Bring a few $5 Starbucks gift cards aboard. Tipping is everywhere now.
no thanks

I always fly Delta - have done trips to Columbia and Thailand - with not much in the way I’d sky miles to show for it. PLEASE - slightly wider seats in economy and a bit more leg room in economy would be fantastic. I’m petite and not obese - and I just don’t have Uber-$$$ to spend, but traveling needs to be comfortable for the “most” of us again! And, as other commenters have correctly said, the miles program is sorely lacking.
How bout some more leg room
Looks great. Can’t wait to see it in person!

No one sits in wheelchairs onboard any aircraft. Why aren't they able to sit in airplane seats?
you are not permitted to sit in a wheelchair during flight…for any carrier.

Not all wheelchair users are able to sit in airplane seats due to their physical disability.
Agree. The airlines should be able to accommodate a wheelchair user without any additional issues. Other modes of public transportation do!
My point exactly. You understand!
I do understand! It really is a need which airlines should address.

yes, because people with disabilities are poor.
“The DOT, FAA, and Delta Air Lines are working to allow wheelchair users to fly in their own wheelchairs.”

You want to show us how great your new interiors are? Give us back our leg room, bigger more comfortable seats, movies, meals, and a complimentary cocktail…oh, and flight staff that will actually help passengers! Older, short, single parents with children, or anyone with any special needs would appreciate help getting carry on bags into the overhead bins instead of hoping a fellow passenger will help. Airline profits are at all time highs, but service is at all time lows!

Delta is a scam they pulled the same scam on us two times in a row claiming oh there's bad weather at the arrival destination we have to delay your flight they deleted three separate times for a total of three and a half hours later causing us to miss our connecting flight which in turn cause them to rebook us on a different flight but put us in the last row of the main cabin although we have a first class ticket for the entire trip and they offer no reimbursement at all. If that wasn't bad enough.. they're doing the exact same scam on the return leg of the trip oh we have to delay the flight now we have to do it again bad weather at the gaining Airport don't worry we'll rebook you and then rebook first class passengers in coach and tell you there's nothing they can do about it because it's the weather is out of their control that's the scam that Delta is now pulling
Sorry for the inconvenience caused we apologies for the way you were treated kindly share your whatsApp number for further assistance please.

how convenient that no one answers the telephone when you call Delta to ask for a refund for their crap a service and their scamming process of booking you on a lower class flight than paid for but oh no nobody's available to take a call
kindly share your whatsApp number for assistance please.

Shame on you Delta Airlines Skylounge TPA. You just turned away an Army veteran, with his service dog who had a first class ticket to fly out at 8am today. The flight was delayed for over 2 hours with passengers already boarded, then cancelled and he was rebooted for a 5pm flight. So here is someone who just with the 1st class ticket should be allowed access (AA would have), but then he has a service dog with a PTSD patch on it. The gentleman also has early Alzheimers (which you wouldn't have known about) and is out of his home comfort zone. I wasn't a DL fan before and I'm certainly less of one now.

a first class domestic ticket doesn't come with lounge access. Same policy for all US carriers, including AA. It is a membership lounge, not a first class lounge. If you want lounge access you generally will need to purchase a lounge membership.

ok. My bad on that. Still say it would have been a great gesture after non-weather related delay after delay, then cancellation and rebooking over 9 HRS LATER (and we won't even mention the 2 hr delay that then happened for the connecting flight in ATL, because one surely would have expected their bad luck to run out with just the one delay). The reason I'm indignant over this, is here is a 75 year old Vietnam veteran with his ptsd service dog. It truly would have been a great gesture, but instead an opportunity lost. So when he should have gotten home around 11am, he landed around 11pm. I'm not entirely sure why he wasn't booked on another airline to get him home. I wish I had been there to raise the stink to the level it needed to go.
Super…the next step is to get CEO Ed Bastian fired! He is awful In my opinion and has ruined our Delta SkyMile program
the best in the industry
nope
yes they are great in flying and their safety record but awful in their SkyMiles program … please get your facts straight and get real

The best sky lounges in the USA - the best credit card program - easy to redeem points - lots of other perks year round ! Including head start - free drinks - Delta one lounges! The list goes on and on!

again, you missed the main point…let me be clear because apparently you can’t fix stupid…they have downgraded their Delta SkyMile program and if we use our SkyMiles for flights etc we do not, repeat, do not get any MQDs so we can retain our status. Regional and global upgrades are benefits they give you based upon your medallion status. You need to read the Delta SkyMile program in depth. I will not reply to you again.
hahaha- poor dear I see Spirit in your future!
I’m a 1.5 million miler with Delta. Of all the mileage loyalty programs I’m in, it’s the best.
Wow. Does name calling make you feel better?

yes 
 it’s delta not delts for one, secondly, tell me what good all our miles are when we use them we get absolutely no MQDs and we most likely have a very difficult time maintaining ￼ medallion status…. If you can’t understand that, well…what can I say about your knowledge about the new delta SkyMile program
I received MQDs when I used miles end of 2024...not sure this is correct unless they have changed the program again.

"our"? They are rewarding the customers who spend the most money with the airline. Plain and simple. I miss the various loopholes and ways of getting higher status without spending a ton of money with Delta, but it is the direction in which all of the airlines are heading.

they are taking advantage of most of their customers…I have nearly 3 million miles which are worthless because if I use them for flights I get no MQDs and can’t retain my diamond status….also, who pays for most for flight? Not the flyers but their company which they offset from the corporate taxes…so get really

Well...using miles to pay for a flight doesn't give you status. That only makes sense. They give status for money paid. Also, you miles aren't worthless -- you can use them to purchase a ticket. It seems you want more than what they are offering.
Useless? You could fly a lot of places with that many miles. And why should you expect any bonus for using miles? You got MQM when you did spend money. You don’t get to double-dip.
Yes he needs to go post haste.

, also, be careful what you wish for. Delta has thrived under his leadership and he has helped lead Delta to be a premium airline… instead of racing to the bottom, like most of the others. Would you rather have me or the old CEOs from US Airways/American, who treated their customers with disdain?
Had the opportunity to fly AMS-ATL in Delta One on this one yesterday. Great experience!
how are the footwells? Spacious? Easy to turn over in lay flat?

the most spacious footwell I’ve experienced so far in any D1 product, and I’m 6’3” with big feet. The sleeping space felt reasonable, including for turning around. I also appreciated the new breathable, non-leather surface

sure! i hate flying for long distance because of these old planes,no comfort at all

My two worst flight experiences have been with Delta. Today's experience from Puerto Rico to Austin, TX was terrible. They changed my flight twice. They downgraded me from First Class to Comfort+ even though there were free seats in First Class. They sent my luggage to another destination. They forced me to wait at the airport until the next day for my luggage to arrive because there was no one available to take it to my hotel. I called to file a complaint and they told me that complaints can only be filed on their website, and I still haven't been able to file a complaint because there's an error with the flight number. I think they need to work more on improving customer service instead of continuing to expand.

I am writing to formally demand compensation for what can only be described as an absolute disaster of a travel experience on 03/10 and 03/11 2025. From the moment I arrived at the airport, your airline subjected me to a series of unacceptable failures, culminating in the loss of my luggage and a delayed arrival at my final destination.

Because of the uncertainty in the economy, I have canceled a river cruise for later this year. It would have involved a flight to Europe. I was not the only one who canceled. If things keep going the way they are, planes will be empty.
This is obviously a robot responding!! Customer service is turning into a total joke.

The morning before we were set to fly home I went to check in for our return flight on Delta's app and their system was down. I had no reception again until the afternoon. I checked again and our flight wasn't showing. I called in and was told that anytime you have a round trip flight and the first half gets called by law they need to cancel the second half. And was offered 1 way tickets that cost more than our original round trip tickets. I said I would not be paying that and asked for a manager. That manager told me it was an error it was canceled as the representative just forgot to click a button to save my return flight. And the best she could do to help us was get us on our original flight at the same cost. Every apology was followed by a but it's policy. And flying isn't guaranteed. And you have to be prepared for issues. And its out of their control. And FAA makes us do this.
